It defines the visual appearance and behavior of the Toolbar, including a centered text label, optional edit and add buttons, and styling properties. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file, as it is a declarative layout definition.\\n\\nThe file defines the following elements:\\n\\n`androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar`: Defines the main Toolbar component, including its size, background color, and theme.\\n`TextView`: Defines a text label that is centered within the Toolbar.\\n`ImageView`: Defines two optional image buttons (edit and add) that are positioned on the right side of the Toolbar.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the visual and functional aspects of a Toolbar component that can be used in an Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/add_team_bottom_dialog.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a team addition feature. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the various UI elements and their properties. Here\\u0027s a summary of the file:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container that holds all the UI elements in a vertical orientation.\\n\\n`View`: A horizontal line at the top of the layout.\\n\\n`RelativeLayout`: A container that holds the team addition UI elements.\\n\\n`TextView`: Displays the \\\"Select team from list\\\" text.\\n\\n`TextInputLayout`: Containers for the team name and city input fields.\\n\\n`TextInputEditText`: The actual editable text fields for team name and city.\\n\\n`CircleImageView`: Displays the team logo.\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: A container that holds the \\\"Add photo\\\" button.\\n\\n`MaterialButton`: The \\\"Submit\\\" button at the bottom of the layout.\\n\\nOverall, this file defines the visual layout and structure of a team addition feature, including input fields, a team logo, and a submit button.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/Utils/LoadingDialogFragment.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LoadingDialogFragment`, which is a `DialogFragment` that displays a loading spinner. Here\\u0027s a summary of the class and its functions:\\n\\n`LoadingDialogFragment`: A `DialogFragment` that displays a loading spinner.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the layout for the loading dialog fragment and sets the background to be transparent.\\n\\n`show`: Attempts to add the loading dialog fragment to the provided `FragmentManager`, handling any `IllegalStateException` that may occur.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for providing a reusable loading dialog fragment that can be used throughout the application to display a loading spinner when necessary.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/commentary_list_child.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a cricket match scorecard. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a hierarchy of views and layouts that display the match details, player statistics, and ball-by-ball commentary.\\n\\nThe main elements in the file are:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The root layout that contains the entire scorecard.\\n`RelativeLayout`: Layouts that display the end of over information and player details.\\n`TextView`: Views that display the text content, such as player names, scores, and ball-by-ball commentary.\\n`View`: Divider views that separate the different sections of the scorecard.\\n\\nThe file provides a comprehensive visual representation of a cricket match, allowing users to view the match details, player performances, and ball-by-ball updates in a structured and organized manner.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/Adapter/TeamACreatePlayerListAdapter.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`TeamACreatePlayerListAdapter`: This class is an adapter for a RecyclerView that displays a list of players, allowing the user to select up to 11 players.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: This function creates a new view holder for the RecyclerView.\\n`onBindViewHolder`: This function binds the data to the view holder and handles the checkbox selection logic.\\n`getItemCount`: This function returns the number of items in the RecyclerView.\\n`MyViewHolder`: This is a nested class that extends `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` and holds the views for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n`itemClickListener`: This is an interface that defines a method for handling the checkbox selection events.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides the implementation for a custom adapter that manages a list of players and their selection in a RecyclerView.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_add_player.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file for an activity called \\\"AddTournamentActivity\\\". It defines the user interface for a screen that allows the user to add a new player to a tournament. The file includes various UI elements such as a profile picture, input fields for player name and mobile number, dropdown menus for player type and role, and a submit button. Additionally, there is a search view and a recycler view that are hidden by default, which suggests the possibility of a search functionality for existing players.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_scorecard.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a \\\"ScorecardActivity\\\". It includes a toolbar, a tab layout, and a view pager. The layout is designed to display a set of tabs and associated content within a relative layout.\\n\\n`RelativeLayout`: Defines the overall layout structure, including the toolbar, tab layout, and view pager.\\n\\n`TabLayout`: Provides a tab-based interface for navigating between different views or content sections.\\n\\n`ViewPager2`: Allows for the display of multiple pages or views within the activity, with the tabs controlling the navigation between them.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any explicit class or function definitions, but rather defines the layout and structure of the user interface elements for the \\\"ScorecardActivity\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/custom_toast.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines a custom toast message UI. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual elements and properties of the toast message.\\n\\nThe file defines a `LinearLayout` that serves as the container for the toast message. The layout has a background drawable, padding, and is centered horizontally. Inside the `LinearLayout`, there is a `TextView` that displays the toast message text, with a specific font, size, and color.\\n\\nThis layout file can be used in an Android application to display a custom toast message with the defined visual style.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/retrofit/ApiRequest.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `ApiRequest` that contains various methods for making API requests to a server. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`ApiRequest`: This interface defines the API endpoints and the corresponding request/response models for various operations such as user authentication, tournament management, team management, player management, and schedule management.\\n\\n`getSignUp`: Sends a sign-up request with the provided `SignUpBody`.\\n`getVerifyOtp`: Sends a request to verify the OTP for sign-up.\\n`getEmailVerifyOtp`: Sends a request to verify the email OTP.\\n`getLogin`: Sends a login request with the provided `LoginBody`.\\n`getLoginThroughOtp`: Sends a request to log in using a phone number and OTP.\\n`getResetPassword`: Sends a request to reset the password with the provided `ResetPasswordBody`.\\n`getForgotPassword`: Sends a request to reset the password with the provided `ForgetPasswordBody`.\\n`getVerifyEmailOtp`: Sends a request to verify the email OTP.\\n`getUserProfile`: Retrieves the user\\u0027s profile information.\\n`getUserSubmitProfile`: Sends a request to update the user\\u0027s profile information, including an optional profile picture.\\n`getUserSubmitProfileWithoutImage`: Sends a request to update the user\\u0027s profile information without a profile picture.\\n`getAddTournamentResponse`: Sends a request to add a new tournament with the provided details.\\n`getAllTournament`: Retrieves a list of all tournaments.\\n`getMyTournament`: Retrieves a list of tournaments for a specific user.\\n`getAddTeamResponse`: Sends a request to add a new team with the provided details.\\n`getTournamentDetails`: Retrieves the details of a specific tournament.\\n`getMyTeam`: Retrieves a list of the user\\u0027s teams.\\n`addTeamInTournamnet`: Sends a request to add a team to a tournament.\\n`getTeamDetails`: Retrieves the details of a specific team.\\n`addPayer`: Sends a request to add a new player with the provided details.\\n`getMyPlayer`: Retrieves a list of the user\\u0027s players.\\n`addPlayerInTeam`: Sends a request to add a player to a team.\\n`removePlayer`: Sends a request to remove a player from a team.\\n`removeTeam`: Sends a request to remove a team.\\n`removeTeamFromTournament`: Sends a request to remove a team from a tournament.\\n`addSchedule`: Sends a request to add a new schedule.\\n`getScheduleMatchList`: Retrieves a list of scheduled matches.\\n`getScheduleMatchDetails`: Retrieves the details of a specific scheduled match.\\n`updateSelectedTeamPlayer`: Sends a request to update the selected team and players for a scheduled match.\\n`updateSchedule`: Sends a request to update a schedule.\\n`toss`: Sends a request to perform a toss for a scheduled match.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/live_bg.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. managing the live scoring functionality of a cricket match, including displaying the scorecard, commentary, and providing various options for the user to interact with the scoring process.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is the entry point of the activity and initializes the UI components, sets up the toolbar, and handles the various user interactions such as starting the scoring, displaying the scorecard, and managing the bottom sheet dialogs.\\n\\n`showBottomBattingSheetDialog()`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that allows the user to select the batting style and the batsmen.\\n\\n`showBottomBatting1SheetDialog(String)`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that allows the user to replace the first batsman.\\n\\n`showBottomBatting2SheetDialog(String)`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that allows the user to replace the second batsman.\\n\\n`showBottomBowlingSheetDialog(String)`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that allows the user to select the bowler.\\n\\n`showStartScoringBottomSheetDialog(LinearLayout)`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that provides the user with various options to start, end, or pause the scoring session.\\n\\n`changeScorerShowBottomSheetDialog()`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that allows the user to change the scorer.\\n\\n`showBottomStopMatchSheetDialog()`: This function displays a bottom sheet dialog that provides the user with various options to stop the match, such as due to rain, drinks break, or other reasons.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_match.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file for a `MatchFragment` class. It defines the visual structure of the fragment, which includes a `RecyclerView` to display a list of items.\\n\\n`FrameLayout`: A container view that holds other views and positions them according to the `FrameLayout` rules.\\n\\n`RecyclerView`: A view that efficiently displays large data sets by only rendering the visible items on the screen.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any classes or functions. It is responsible for defining the layout and structure of the `MatchFragment` in the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/view_model/LoginThroughOtpViewModel.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LoginThroughOtpViewModel`, which is a ViewModel class responsible for handling the login process through an OTP (One-Time Password) mechanism.\\n\\n`LoginThroughOtpViewModel`: A ViewModel class that manages the login process through an OTP mechanism, including handling the progress and result of the login operation.\\n\\n`LoginThroughOtpViewModel()`: The constructor of the `LoginThroughOtpViewModel` class, which initializes the progress and result LiveData objects and creates an instance of the `LoginRepository` class.\\n\\n`getLoginThroughOtp(String phoneNumber)`: A function that initiates the login process through an OTP, by calling the `getLoginThroughOtp()` method of the `LoginRepository` class and updating the progress and result LiveData objects accordingly.\\n\\n`getLoginThroughOtpProgress()`: A function that returns a LiveData object representing the progress of the login operation.\\n\\n`getLoginThroughOtpResult()`: A function that returns a LiveData object representing the result of the login operation.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/logout_black_24dp.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a vector graphic image. The image represents an arrow pointing to the left, with a path that starts from the top-left corner, moves to the right, and then down to the bottom-left corner. This vector graphic can be used in Android applications as a visual element, such as an icon or a button.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/prize.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable file that defines a vector image of a lock icon. The vector image has a width and height of 24dp, and it has a path that defines the shape of the lock icon. The path includes details such as the lock body, the keyhole, and the lock mechanism.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_your_player_list.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file for the `AddTournamentActivity`. It defines the user interface for the activity, which includes a toolbar, a card view for selecting a team, a submit button, and a recycler view to display a list of teams.\\n\\n`RelativeLayout`: The main layout container that holds all the UI elements.\\n\\n`MaterialCardView`: A card view that displays a message and a dropdown for selecting a team.\\n\\n`MaterialButton`: A button that allows the user to submit the selected team.\\n\\n`RecyclerView`: A view that displays a list of teams.\\n\\n`SelectTournamentType`: A custom view that provides a dropdown for selecting a team.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions, as it is an XML layout file that defines the user interface for the `AddTournamentActivity`.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/ParamBody/ToasParamBody.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `ToasParamBody`, which is used to represent a data structure for storing information related to a cricket match, such as the toss winner team ID, batting team ID, schedule match ID, and a message.\\n\\n`ToasParamBody`: A class that represents a data structure for storing information related to a cricket match.\\n\\n`getToss_winner_team_id()`: Returns the toss winner team ID.\\n`setToss_winner_team_id(int toss_winner_team_id)`: Sets the toss winner team ID.\\n`getBatting_team_id()`: Returns the batting team ID.\\n`setBatting_team_id(int batting_team_id)`: Sets the batting team ID.\\n`getSchedule_match_id()`: Returns the schedule match ID.\\n`setSchedule_match_id(int schedule_match_id)`: Sets the schedule match ID.\\n`getMessage()`: Returns the message.\\n`setMessage(String message)`: Sets the message.\\n`ToasParamBody(int toss_winner_team_id, int batting_team_id, int schedule_match_id, String message)`: Constructs a `ToasParamBody` object with the given parameters.\",\"/app/src/main/res/anim/bounce.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines an XML animation resource for Android applications.\\n\\nThe file defines a set of animation properties that can be applied to a view or element in an Android app. The animation is a scale animation that starts with the view at 50% of its original size and scales it up to 100% over a duration of 500 milliseconds. The animation uses the \\\"bounce_interpolator\\\" to create a bouncing effect as the view scales up.\\n\\nThis type of animation resource can be used in Android apps to create dynamic and engaging user interfaces, such as when a new element is added to the screen or when a user interacts with a view.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/arrow_circle_up_black_24dp.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a circular icon with an arrow pointing down. The icon is 24 by 24 pixels in size and has a black fill color. The vector drawable can be used in Android applications to display this icon.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/cricoscore/Adapter/TabAdapter.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TabAdapter`, which is a `FragmentStateAdapter` implementation used to manage the fragments displayed in a `ViewPager2` component.\\n\\n`TabAdapter`: A `FragmentStateAdapter` that manages the fragments displayed in a `ViewPager2` component, with three fragments: `TournamentFragment`, `MatchFragment`, and `LiveFragment`.\\n\\n`createFragment(int position)`: Returns the appropriate fragment based on the given position in the `ViewPager2`.\\n\\n`getItemCount()`: Returns the total number of fragments managed by the adapter, which is 3.\",\"/app/src/main/res/anim/back_animator.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines an XML animation resource for Android. The animation consists of the following:\\n\\n1. An `objectAnimator` that fades the view out by setting its `alpha` property to 0 over 0 milliseconds.\\n2. An `objectAnimator` that rotates the view 180 degrees around the X-axis, then back to 0 degrees over 800 milliseconds, with a reverse repeat mode.\\n3. An `objectAnimator` that fades the view in by setting its `alpha` property to 1 over 0 milliseconds, with a 500 millisecond delay.\\n\\nThis animation resource can be used to create a visual effect, such as a view fading out, rotating, and then fading back in, which can be used in an Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/change_scorere_dialog.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a \\\"Change Scorer\\\" screen. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the various UI elements and their layout properties. Here\\u0027s a summary of the file:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container that holds the entire layout.\\n`FrameLayout`: Holds the header section of the screen, which displays the \\\"Change Scorer\\\" text.\\n`LinearLayout`: Holds the \\\"Select Scorer\\\" text and a dropdown menu for selecting the scorer.\\n`RelativeLayout`: Holds the \\\"Save\\\" and \\\"Cancel\\\" buttons at the bottom of the screen.\\n\\nThe file sets up the visual structure and appearance of the \\\"Change Scorer\\\" screen, including the header, the scorer selection dropdown, and the save/cancel buttons. It uses various Android layout and UI components to achieve the desired design.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/dropbox_status.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML file that defines a custom shape for an Android application. The shape has the following properties:\\n\\n- `\\u003csolid\\u003e`: Sets the background color of the shape to white.\\n- `\\u003cstroke\\u003e`: Adds a dark grey border around the shape with a width of 1 dp.\\n- `\\u003ccorners\\u003e`: Sets the radius of the corners to 10 dp, making the shape rounded.\\n\\nThis custom shape can be used as a background for various UI elements in the Android app, such as buttons, text views, or containers.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/bottom_dialog_select_palyer.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a screen where users can select a batsman, bowler, and their respective batting and bowling styles.\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container that holds the entire layout.\\n\\n`FrameLayout`: A container that holds the header section of the layout.\\n\\n`TextView`: Displays the header text \\\"Select Batsman/Bowler\\\".\\n\\n`RelativeLayout`: Containers that hold the batsman, bowler, and their respective batting and bowling style selections.\\n\\n`com.cricoscore.Utils.SelectStatusType`: A custom view that displays a dropdown menu for selecting players.\\n\\n`androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView`: Displays the list of batting and bowling styles for the selected players.\\n\\n`MaterialButton`: Buttons for \\\"Save\\\" and \\\"Cancel\\\" actions.\"}"}
